org.webcurator.auth
Interface AuthorityManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
AuthorityManagerImpl
public interface AuthorityManager

The AuthorityManager Interface provides all the methods required to determine if Users in the system have the Authority to carry out certain actions based on their privileges.

Author:
bprice

Method Detail

hasPrivilege

boolean hasPrivilege(AgencyOwnable object,
                     java.lang.String privilege)
checks whether the logged in user has the appropriate privilege on the ownable object.

Parameters:
object - the WCT object to verify ownership of. The object must implement the AgencyOwnable Interface
privilege - the privilege to check for
Returns:
true if the scoped privilege is found, otherwise false

hasPrivilege

boolean hasPrivilege(User user,
                     java.lang.String privilege,
                     int scope)
determines if the specified user has the correct privilege. For a Privilege to match it must be of the same scope.

Parameters:
user - the User object
privilege - the privilege to check for
scope - the scope of the Privilege to check for
Returns:
true if this user has the correctly scoped privilege

hasPrivilege

boolean hasPrivilege(java.lang.String privilege,
                     int scope)
determines if the logged in user has the correct privilege. For a Privilege to match it must be of the same scope.

Parameters:
privilege - the privilege to check for
scope - the scope of the Privilege to check for
Returns:
true if this user has the correctly scoped privilege

getPrivilegesForUser

java.util.HashMap getPrivilegesForUser(User user)
gets a single Map of Privileges that this User has based on their Role membership. The HashMap will contain the Privilege the user has with the broadest scope.

Parameters:
user - the User object
Returns:
a HashMap of all Privileges this user has keyed by the Privilege code

hasAtLeastOnePrivilege

boolean hasAtLeastOnePrivilege(java.lang.String[] privilege)
checks if the user has one of the specified privileges independant of the privilege scope.

Parameters:
privilege - a String array of Privilege codes to look for
Returns:
true if the User has at least one privilege in the set

hasAtLeastOnePrivilege

boolean hasAtLeastOnePrivilege(UserOwnable subject,
                               java.lang.String... privileges)
checks if the user has one of the specified privileges against the specified object.

Parameters:
privileges - a String array of Privilege codes to look for
subject - The subject to check permissions against.
Returns:
true if the User has at least one privilege in the set

getPrivilegeScope

int getPrivilegeScope(java.lang.String privilege)
                      throws NoPrivilegeException
gets the Logged In Users scope for the specified Privilege

Parameters:
privilege - the Privilege
Returns:
the Scope of the specified privilege
Throws:
NoPrivilegeException - thrown if the user does not have the specified privilege

getPrivilegeScopeNE

int getPrivilegeScopeNE(java.lang.String privilege)
gets the Logged In Users scope for the specified Privilege without throwing exceptions.

Parameters:
privilege - the Privilege
Returns:
the Scope of the specified privilege, none if the user does not have the privilege.

getProfileLevel

int getProfileLevel()
Retrieves the profile level for the currently logged in user.

Returns:
The maximum level that the logged in user has access to.
